definition: Zhu Di, personal name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]
surname Zhu
vermilion
cinnabar/see 硃砂|朱砂[zhu1 sha1]
Kerria japonica

sentences.english: Watch an interview with Energy Secretary Steven Chu.
sentences.chinese: 观看对能源部长朱棣文的采访。

sentences.english: Chu claimed he detected no sign of resentment from the developing countries.
sentences.chinese: 朱棣文宣称，他没有从发展中国家看到愤恨的迹象。

sentences.english: Both Locke and Chu have had experience working with the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 骆家辉和朱棣文都曾和中国人一起共事。

sentences.english: Chu's lengthy speech ran past the allotted time for questions from the students.
sentences.chinese: 由于朱棣文演讲超时，学生们最后没有时间提问了。

sentences.english: The first ruler who actually lived here was Ming Emperor Zhudi.
sentences.chinese: 第一位居住再这里的统治者是明朝皇帝朱棣。

sentences.english: It was erected by Zhu's son.
One of them –Dr. Steve Chu –is my boss at the Department of Energy.
sentences.chinese: 其中之一就是朱棣文博士，他是我在能源部的老板。

sentences.english: Chu's figures describe the total value of Chinese exports.
sentences.chinese: 朱棣文的数据表述了中国的出口总值。

sentences.english: In 1420 the Emperor moved into his new premises.

definition: Zhu Yuanwen, personal name of second Ming Emperor Jianwen 建文[Jian4 Wen2]
Zhu Yuanzhang, personal name of first Ming dynasty emperor Hongwu 洪武[Hong2 wu3]
reign name of second Ming emperor, reigned 1398-1402, deposed in 1402
Ming Chengzu, Temple name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]
Zhu Zhanji, personal name of fifth Ming emperor Xuande 宣德[Xuan1 de2]
Zhu Gaochi, personal name of fourth Ming emperor Hongxi 洪熙[Hong2 Xi1]
Ming Taizu, Temple name of first Ming emperor Hongwu 洪武[Hong2 wu3]
Zhu Qizhen, personal name of sixth and eighth Ming emperor Zhengtong 正統|正统[Zheng4 tong3], afterwards Tianshun Emperor 天順|天顺[Tian1 shun4] (1427-1464), reigned 1435-1449 and 1457-1464
war of 1402 between successors of the first Ming Emperor
Chongzhen, reign name of last Ming emperor (1628-1644)
Temple name of fifth Ming emperor Xuande 宣德[Xuan1 de2]
Ming Renzong, Temple name of fourth Ming emperor Zhu Gaochi 朱高熾|朱高炽[Zhu1 Gao1 chi4]
Wei Zhongxian (1568-1627), infamous eunuch politician of late Ming
Li Shimin, personal name of second Tang emperor Taizong 唐太宗[Tang2 Tai4 zong1] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Zhu Houzhao, personal name of tenth Ming emperor 正德[Zheng4 de2] (1491-1521), reigned 1505-1521
Yingzong, Temple name of sixth and eighth Ming emperor Zhengtong 正統|正统[Zheng4 tong3]
